It's a little condensed slice of a happy outdoor recreational goodness appropriate for the whole family. The dog park always had at least a couple of four legged friends romping about, sniffing in the sights. For a great feel the burn walk/round of self inflicted pain and torture day, start from Van Ness up Clay and then take the long way up. If you have hyper active kids with you (perhaps friends are visiting from out of town and they brought their little terrors with them or you have some sweet little beesters of your own) make them do this walk with promises of one of the coolest playgrounds ever. There's plenty of things for them to climb, swing on, spin on enough to put themselves into napland while the folks can take pictures, layout, meet other visitors/locals, have a picnic--all the fun parky things you can think of in a setting that's quintessental San Francisco. 

P.S. Being that this place is so San Francisco, the wind up here can be a little nippy. Consider bringing a windbreaker/ sweatshirt and/ or bubbles. The sweatshirt will keep you warm and the bubbles will keep you entertained.
author: Veronica G.

description: Attractive people doing all kinds of attractive things.... I wouldn't recommend smoking here though...
author: Chris C.

description: I have spent a lot of time in this park.  Beautiful views, great location near Fillmore St. shops and restaurants.  Oh and there are tennis courts!! If you want  some exercise while there, take the steps on the south side of the park up and down, up and down.
author: Amanda P.

description: My kid's favorite park in the city - and mine too! The playground is so cushion-y soft and check out the sandbox. You have never felt sand as soft and beautiful as that - outside of some beaches in Hawaii maybe. The view of the city is fantastic and proximity to Fillmore is great if you want to pick up some lunch or coffee or what have you!
author: Melani A.

description: Great spot for letting your dog romp with other well socialized mutts.  Lots of space and friendly owners to chat with.  Head for the Jackson/Scott corner between 6 - 7:30 now that its staying light longer.
author: Tracy C.

description: Small dog run on Washington Street side also used by caretakers of adoptable dogs from Pets Unlimited; plastic bags stored on wooden post for humans to pick up after dogs they are caretakers, 60 year old Afro-Amer. woe-man with old toy terrier never picking up after poop pellets, damn does the same thing on Fillmore Street and Hamilton Park. Rant and Rave. Will someone just toss those pellets on her ass cuz she could give a rats' ass about picking up her dog's shit pellets.
author: miriam b.

description: Awesome dog park!  Yes, dogs rule SF.  I live super close to this wonder and take my dog almost daily.  Your dog can roam off leash and smell all the stains and spots and do her business where ever she likes (just pick it up, please).  Most people are pretty cool, but there are always a few people with their kick-me dogs that freak out when your dog runs up to them to play.  Not my baby!!!!  Yes, my dog may be part pit bull but get over yourself.  Any whoo, this place is green, has a billion dollar view of the bay, an awesome kiddy play ground and great grass.  My only complaint is the dang wind.  It never seems to stop but I guess I should get over that fact since it is a natural occurrence called San Francisco.
author: Carolyn D.

description: Great park for kiddos who like to stalk dogs in between trips back/forth to the twirly slide. Kudos to the friendly dog owners who nicely share their slimey tennis balls with demanding toddlers.
author: S S.

description: i love going to this place during all hours of the day. perfect for a warm summer/fall day to just lay out in the sun and scope out the beautiful view of SF's mid city. the view is equally spectacular if not better at night. never very crowded like dolores park which is also a nice perk. always the occassional dog walkers and school kids at the playground. the spots complete with tennis and basketball courts too. be careful on the basketball court though, always has tiny pebbles that have caused nasty falls for me. many stitches attributed to that court. but i love the spot never the less.
author: Andrew D.

description:
except for twin peaks, i would say that this offers one of the best views of SF.  free street parking if you can find it and if you own a dog, i would highly recommend this area.

can you really complain about a place that is free and offers views like this one?  if you walk a little to the corners, you can see views of the bay as well.  awesome park.  the people who live close to this park are spoiled.

you can even visit this park at night for a gorgeous view.  dress lightly if you want to freeze to death.
author: Bryce K.

description: 9/7/09: beautiful park with benches to burn off those calories from lunch. we hung out here for a couple hours enjoying a rare warm san francisco afternoon. hugs and kisses out to the black and tan norwich that taunted us, we miss gherkin! anyways, too bad our kids can't be here to enjoy the park too!
author: Jesse W.

description: I used to love this park.  It's has tons of benches and great views of the city to the south and the marina to the north.  It is a great place to eat lunch or just lay out.  There are also three or four tennis courts that are in really good shape and this would be a great place to play accept for all of the snotty pac heights parents who kept trying to make us leave our court so their kids could play.  I wouldn't bring this up if it happened just once but we were interrupted FOUR times while we were playing one set with people asking if they could take over the court......NO, are you people not familiar with sharing?  You can wait just like everyone else and have it when we're done....and just because you have kids with you doesn't mean you have first choice on everything at the park, yeah they're cute, they need to learn to take turns because apparently you never did.  Anyway, now that I got that off of my chest, I will go back to Alta to eat lunch but I will probably head over to Lafayette to play tennis in the future, even if the courts aren't as nice, at least I won't have to deal with snotty poo people.
author: Jessica H.

description:
it was so sunny and refreshing to play bocce in a new park..

this park was full of dogs, on the top of a hill, sunny, full of lounging couples, nice playground if you have babies..

it was just a nice change from other sunny parks that are full of PBR's and piercings

close to the 22 bus line
author: Kate R.

description: the bf and i have come often w/ a picnic basket of food so that we can enjoy the view and watch the dogs play.  sitting on a bench and looking out to the bay and marin on a sunny day makes me appreciate living in the bay area.  cheesy i know, but it makes for a relaxing afternoon.
author: Helen T.

description:
just a great park.  i like it better than the nearby lafayette.  set on an overlook with a great view southward of the city below, with twin peaks and sutro tower to the southwest, buildings of tenderloin to the southeast.  nice place to walk a dog (though i don't have a dog) and play tennis.  but this is usually a pretty quiet park.

awesome playground, one of the most extensive around.  lots of stuff to keep the little ones occupies, on soft padded artificial surface (as opposed to sand).
author: Greg H.

description: You have to check out the monthly "Pug Fest" that happens here the first Sunday of the month from noon to 4!  Walking through the park seeing all the people having a picnic, tons of children playing on the beautiful play sculptures and equipment, on a beautiful Sunday afternoon, we came upon this herd of little pooches that was hilarious!  Can you imagine seeing at least 30 pugs of all sizes, shapes and ages just running and romping, having a good ol' time! While the majority are white with black, there were some all black pugs to be seen.  Check it out sometime!
author: P G.

description: an open sunny space to chill out and relax. plenty of grassy area to just lay down and stare at the sky. close proximity to fillmore makes alta plaza better for hosting picnics.
author: Court L.
